newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Rents, heating, lighting fuel Dutch 1996 inflation.
newsitem.headline: Rents, heating, lighting fuel Dutch 1996 inflation.

text.p: Higher housing rents and increased costs for heating and lighting were the main reasons for an average 2.1 percent rise in Dutch consumer prices in 1996 compared with the previous year.

The Central Bureau of Statistics (CBS) said on Friday that prices for this category of goods and services rose 4.5 percent last year and accounted for 61 percent of the overall rise in the average 1996 consumer price index.
Rents, with an index weighting of 216/1000, were on average 4.1 percent higher in 1996 than in 1995, while heating and
lighting costs, with a weighting of 45/1000 rose 7.2 percent.
DUTCH 1996 CPI INFLATION Weighting 1996 1995 Change Share
NOTES - Column one shows weighting of subindex in total
index. Columns two and three show subindex values for 1996 and
1995. Column four shows percent change in subindex, 1996 vs
1995. Column five shows percentage contribution of each subindex
